name: holder
content:
holder noun [C]
(CONTAINER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a device for putting objects in or for keeping them in place: a toothbrush holder a cigarette holder
More examplesFewer examplesThe contender faces a world championship fight against the title holder.The 100 metres was won by the world record holder.The franchise holder pays an annual fee for the franchise.He's the current holder of the Commonwealth record.Children under 15 are admitted for free when accompanied by a ticket holder.

holder noun [C]
(OWNER)
someone who officially owns something: an account/licence/passport holder Holders of shares in the company receive various benefits. See also
shareholder

Add to word list
Add to word list
a device for putting objects in or for keeping them in place: a cup/paper towel holder
holder noun [C]
(OWNER)
someone who officially owns something: property holders Competition benefits credit card holders.

FINANCE, LAW a person who officially owns something: a credit card holder Property holders were pleased with the tax cut. See also
